intro: Calophyllum aerarium, commonly known as the aerial calophyllum, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Calophyllaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, often waxy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant is typically found growing in moist, shaded environments in tropical regions. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
